item.title: Shaking and stirred: iPhone 14 Pro camera not behaving with TikTok - but Apple says fix on the way
item.description: Overall, I'm very impressed by Apple's latest handsets. I'm currently trialling an iPhone 14 Pro Max, that has a lot to like on the usability, safety and photography fronts.But when I went to scan a QR code to hire a Beam e-scooter,...

item.description: We all know the routine by heart: "Please ensure your seats are in the upright position, tray tables stowed, window shades are up, laptops are stored in the overhead bins and electronic devices are set to flight mode". Now, the...

item.title: Subduction zone secrets: Is this how NZ forecasts 'megaquakes'?
item.description: Mysterious, silent earthquakes could be key to forecasting the next catastrophic rupture on New Zealand's largest fault: the gigantic Hikurangi Subduction Zone . A newly-funded, million-dollar study will draw on a trove of data...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

enclosure.url: https://media.nzherald.co.nz/webcontent/image/jpg/202239/quake_70x70.jpg?media_subtype_id=16|caption=A GNS Science simulation of a Hikurangi Subduction Zone magnitude 8.4 earthquake. Scientists are investigating whether 'slow-slip events' hold the key to forecasting them. Image / Supplied

item.title: Uber investigating breach of its network
item.description: Uber said Thursday that it reached out to law enforcement after a hacker apparently breached its network. A security engineer said the intruder had provided evidence of obtaining access to crucial cloud systems at the ride-hailing...
item.author: newsfeeds@nzherald.co.nz

item.title: Watch: Rocket Lab launches 'Owl Spreads its Wings' mission, expands US military ties
item.description: A Rocket Lab Electron successfully launched from Mahia at 8.38am today, carrying an Earth-observation satellite for Synspective, a Japanese startup company planning a fleet of 30 radar imaging spacecraft.It was the Kiwi-American...

item.title: Twitter shareholders approve sale to Elon Musk, bringing $65 billion court showdown closer
item.description: Elon Musk may be keen to walk away from his A$65 billion ($72bn) deal to buy Twitter, but the social media firm is in no mood to make it easy for him.Twitter shareholders voted to approve the US$44bn ($73bn) sale of the tech firm...
